title: Simulation Software Engineering Manager
summary: Join the Wireless Technologies and Ecosystems (WTE) organization and be part of an outstanding team of engineers, working with multi-functional teams to drive innovation and develop products used by millions worldwide. We are looking for a highly reciprocal individual who can excel in a high-paced environment. Be ready to make something extraordinary when you come here. Dynamic, encouraging people and innovative, industry-defining technologies are the norm at Apple. The people who work here have reinvented and defined entire industries with our products and services. The same real passion for innovation also applies to our business practices - strengthening our dedication to leave the world better than we found it. You should join Apple if you want to help deliver the next amazing Apple product.
description: You will drive the Pre-Silicon platform for next-generation cellular SOCs. In this role, you will assess the HW changes on the simulation platform, drive discussions with the SW/FW team on finalizing requirements, be involved in a virtual platform design review with the team, driving execution with the team, negotiate a timeline with stakeholders, and present the status. A deep understanding of CPU subsystems, SOC architecture, and wireless systems is required. Experience in SystemC or equivalent tools and the ability to work with multiple collaborators are advantageous.
key_qualifications: As engineering manager of the Settings team, your responsibilities will include: growing and hiring direct reports; prioritizing work across the team; representing the team's work within broad efforts; and influencing collaborators and partners to deliver the needed impact. Analyzing the new SOC architecture and scope out impact on the simulation platform, discussing with various SW/FW collaborators to collect the requirements for pre-silicon platforms. Understanding co-simulation designs, reviewing integration strategies, how scheduling works between different simulators, and providing timely feedback to the team. You will track project status and deliverables, communicate status clearly to leadership and cross-functional partners, and balance high-quality product delivery under tight schedules. You will engage with SW/FW teams to collect pre-silicon requirements, prepare a schedule, and negotiate timelines with collaborators.
education_experience: Bachelor's or Masters degree in computer science or related field
